item.title: Clash Royale: 8 Strongest Troops in Merge Tactics
item.description:
Summary

  • Merge Tactics in Clash Royale offers a unique twist with unpredictable gameplay due to luck factors.
  • Traits in cards boost bonuses and card synergies, impacting match outcomes significantly.
  • Investing points in the right cards, like Skeleton King and Executioner, increases the chances of victory.

It's not a stretch to say that Merge Tactics is a completely different mini-game set in Clash Royale . This is a unique experience that doesn't share the same core gameplay as the main game, but that doesn't mean it isn't enjoyable. The biggest selling point about Merge Tactics is that it is quite unpredictable.

A player on the verge of elimination can all of a sudden come back and win the match, because luck is a crucial factor in Merge Tactics. However, players can only benefit from luck if they know which troops perform better on the battlefield. At the end of the day, only the player who invests their points in the right cards will have the highest chance of victory.

8 Skeleton King

Traits: Undead, Juggernaut

  • Level 11 Stats:
    • HP: 1,400
    • DPS: 84
    • Elixir Cost: 5

Skeleton King might not have a high hit speed, but the fact that every kill adds a Skeleton minion to the battlefield makes it a valuable unit. Aside from dealing more damage to the enemy troops, having more units on the map will also distract ranged damage dealers from primary units, hence increasing their survivability.

The 5-Elixir cost of Skeleton King makes it difficult to get it to a three-star merge, but even at two-star, it can perform pretty well. So, if a player gets this card from the shop earlier in the game, they will have a higher chance of merging later.

7 Executioner

Traits: Ace, Thrower

  • Level 11 Stats:
    • HP: 763
    • DPS: 65
    • Elixir Cost: 3

Executioner is a powerful back-line damage dealer with a medium range. The good thing about Executioner is that he can target more than one enemy as long as they are aligned behind each other in the line of his axe.

Executioner doesn't have any specific abilities, but his damage output greatly increases after merging into a two-star, and three-star literally makes him an unstoppable support unit. If the player manages to have all Thrower troops on the battlefield, Executioner's range will increase by one extra row, making it even deadlier for the opponent's back-line troops.

6 Princess

Traits: Noble, Ranger

  • Level 11 Stats:
    • HP: 620
    • DPS: 82
    • Elixir Cost: 4

Despite being fragile against incoming damage, Princess is one of the most annoying ranged troops in Merge Tactics. She can stand in the second farthest line of the battlefield and still target any Hex on the map. Not only do her shots deal damage to the targeted Hex, but they also have a 2-Hex damage radius, making any adjacent troop take damage as well.

While not as costly as Archer Queen, Princess is a great option for two-star merging. It's slightly better than Executioner due to her longer range and wider target radius, but Executioner's survivability is higher, especially in close-quarter combat.

5 Prince

Traits: Noble, Brawler

  • Level 11 Stats:
    • HP: 872
    • DPS: 96
    • Elixir Cost: 3

On his own, Prince is not a great option, but he proves his value through teamwork. When a player has more than 4 troops on the team, a Prince can significantly help with outnumbering the opponent for a short duration.

There is a passive ability for Prince that allows it to knock back the tankiest enemy troop as soon as the battle begins. This also applies a brief stun on the targeted enemy, which means it will be removed from the initial fight for a few seconds, giving the player more chances of wiping out the other frontline troops.

Prince has a slow hit speed, and that makes him weak earlier in the game. But building a tanky army around Prince is strongly recommended.

4 Goblin Machine

Traits: Goblin, Juggernaut

  • Level 11 Stats:
    • HP: 1,137
    • DPS: 82
    • Elixir Cost: 4

Goblin Machine is like a more advanced version of Prince that comes with a similar ability. Unlike Prince, the damage output from Goblin Machine isn't high, but this card is quite tanky, which helps it survive for a longer duration.

Goblin Machine can launch a rocket and target any random enemy on the map. The rocket applies some damage, but more importantly, stuns the target for a short duration. Merging the Goblin Machine increases the number of rockets it can launch. At two-star, he can target two enemies simultaneously, while at three-star, he shoots three rockets.

The only downside is that rockets are not launched immediately after the game begins. Goblin Machine needs to survive the initial fights to be able to launch its rockets.

3 Golden Knight

Traits: Noble, Assassin

  • Level 11 Stats:
    • HP: 1,200
    • DPS: 112
    • Elixir Cost: 5

Most of the tanky troops in Merge Tactics come either with slow hit speed or weak damage output, but Golden Knight finds a perfect balance between delivering a fast hit speed and a big chunk of health bar.

Golden Knight is worth every Elixir point spent on it. Even at the base level, Golden Knight can be a force to be reckoned with. His ability is activated once he scores a kill. The ability allows Golden Knight to dash towards the next target, dealing dash damage and reaching the target almost instantly.

If the player manages to get all Assassin troops, the Golden Knight will jump immediately to the backline of the enemy at the beginning of the match, slaughtering the opponent's ranged troops.

2 Royal Ghost

Traits: Undead, Assassin

  • Level 11 Stats:
    • HP: 879
    • DPS: 134
    • Elixir Cost: 4

Royal Ghost's unbelievably powerful ability makes him a top candidate for a nerf in the near future. Royal Ghost isn't just strong, but rather overpowered. The unit's ability allows it to deal damage while invisible, and when it gets invisible, troops targeting Royal Ghost get distracted and find another target. This lifts all the attention from Royal Ghost while he continues to deal damage.

However, the main problem is not the nature of the ability but how quickly it gets activated. Royal Ghost's invisibility is triggered after he lands three hits. But after his invisibility is over, he gets invisible for every single regular hit. This means Royal Ghost lands more hits during invisibility than it does during normal phase, which makes it just unstoppable. Only Valkyrie can deal with Royal Ghost, and that's only when there is a troop next to Royal Ghost.

1 Archer Queen

Traits: Clan, Avenger

  • Level 11 Stats:
    • HP: 849
    • DPS: 72
    • Elixir Cost: 5

Archer Queen is a master of clutch in Merge Tactics. She can always turn the tide of the battle single-handedly, thanks to her extremely powerful invisibility. It seems like Supercell is really having a problem with balancing the invisibility in Merge Tactics, as every unit with this particular ability is quite powerful.

While Archer Queen's invisibility is not activated as frequently as Royal Ghost's, every merge allows her to target one more enemy simultaneously. So, even in a 1v2 or 1v3 situation, Archer Queen can still be quite deadly to enemies and wipe them all while invisible.

Also, the Avenger trait helps Archer Queen significantly, as her damage output is doubled when she is the only survivor on the map from the Avenger team. So, this makes her invisibility even more fruitful.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: How to Get Balazan's Maxtlatl in Diablo 4
item.description:
Balazan's Maxtlatl is a Spiritborn Unique in Diablo 4 that was introduced in Season 9, and it's an amazing item to have for players who want to push the endgame with a Poison or Thorns-based build. It gives the Centipede build path for the Spiritborn some much needed help, and while it won't quite compare to Eagle and Jaguar builds, it opens up a lot of opportunities for players to make some silly and strong setups.

If you're trying to make a Centipede Spiritborn build in Diablo 4 , then Balazan's Maxtlatl should definitely be one of the items you should aim to have. Here are some tips on how you can get this Unique item as quickly as possible.

Diablo 4 Balazan's Maxtlatl Drop Location

You can get Balazan's Maxtlatl through any item source that can drop Unique items , but if you want to target farm it, you'll need to fight Varshan in his hole next to the Tree of Whispers . Players can challenge Varshan at any time by touching his altar within his boss room, but if you want to have any hope of getting loot that's actually worth your while, you need to spend 12 Malignant Hearts to open his Treasure Hoard .

In previous seasons, players had to spend boss materials just to challenge their boss of choice. This is no longer the case, and if they want to get boss loot, they need to use those materials to open Hoard chests that appear after the boss has been defeated.

Where to Farm Malignant Hearts

Whisper Caches from the Tree of Whispers in Diablo 4 have a pretty solid chance of rewarding players with Malignant Hearts, assuming they're playing on Torment 1 difficulty or higher. While not necessarily the fastest, farming Whisper bounties set in Dungeons is the most convenient, as completing two of these is enough to earn you a Whisper Cache.

Alternatively, Kurast Undercity is excellent for boss material farming , but only if you have a Tribute of Titans in your inventory. These Tributes will guarantee a shower of boss materials at the end of your Undercity run.

Lastly, you can always check in with Fayira, Raheir's daughter at The Den in Kurast . She'll occasionally sell boss material caches for Pale Marks. You can refresh her store after you buy a cache for a chance to buy another cache.

Is Balazan's Maxtlatl Any Good?

Definitely, though it's specifically meant for Poison Thorns builds (like the ones using Scourge). When equipped, attacks against Close enemies deal your Thorns damage, and those enemies are Poisoned by that same amount. When you retaliate with Thorns, the Poisoning damage increases by up to 300%.

This opens up a lot of build paths for Centipede builds, and if you're already using one, it should give you a noticeable performance improvement even without making much changes to your existing setup.

item.title: Nintendo Has a Plan to Make Games More Quickly
item.description:
Nintendo has a plan to tackle the rising costs of video game development and potentially start making select titles more quickly, the company's leadership said. However, details on the matter are currently slim, and the only thing that's certain is that this mysterious plan won't be applicable to all future Nintendo games.

The length of game development cycles has historically grown in stages. Until the mid-1990s, what was considered a big-budget game was typically completed within one or two years, as with The Elder Scrolls: Arena . The transition from 2D to 3D graphics in the late 1990s extended typical development time to around three years. The PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 generation marked the first era in which AAA games regularly took more than three years to complete, sometimes up to five. Today, a five-year development cycle is considered the minimum for most AAA titles, with a few exceptions such as FromSoftware games that rely heavily on reused assets.

During a recent Q&A session with shareholders, Nintendo President Shuntaro Furukawa fielded a question about this state of affairs, framed as a big-picture concern: that the Switch 2s significantly greater power compared to its predecessor could lead to higher game development costs, increased software prices, and ultimatelyand counterintuitivelya "decrease in the gaming population." The executive confirmed that Nintendo is currently making "the necessary investments for more efficient development," thus reiterating a pledge he made around this time last year. However, Furukawa also provided a bit more detail on the matter, more than is typical for a shareholder Q&A setting.

Nintendo Sees 'One Potential Solution' to Current Game Dev Cycles

"We also believe it is possible to develop game software with shorter development periods that still offer consumers a sense of novelty," Furukawa said. He labeled this train of thought as "one potential solution" to the rising video game development costs and software prices, stating that Nintendo "will explore it from various angles within the company." The executive did not elaborate any further, though this statement itself suggests the potential solution will only be applicable to some projects.

We also believe it is possible to develop game software with shorter development periods that still offer consumers a sense of novelty. We see this as one potential solution to the concern about rising development costs and software prices, and we will explore it from various angles within the company.

Nintendo Could Be Returning to AA Games

As the transitions from 2D to 3D and from 3D to HD graphics demonstrated, asset creation has long been one of the biggest bottlenecks in game development. The higher the visual fidelity, the longer AAA gameswhere consumer expectations are highesttake to produce. Furukawas comments could therefore be interpreted as a hint that Nintendo may shift more focus toward AA titles in the future. Until the mid-2000s, the company regularly invested in several such franchises, including Excite , BoxBoy , and Pushmo .

Where Did All the AA Games Go?

AA games declined in popularity among major publishers for reasons similar to those that have lengthened AAA development cycles: increased asset requirements, greater technological complexity, and larger teams that are harder to coordinate. These factors drove up costs, making smaller projects less economically attractive and pushing publishers to prioritize fewer, larger-scale bets. If Nintendo is indeed considering AA projects as "one potential solution" to current development challenges, it may also be rethinking how such games can be produced more efficiently than in the past.

item.title: Most Controversial GTA Missions, Ranked
item.description:
Even people who have never played a video game in their entire lives would surely know that the Grand Theft Auto series is not about doing the right thing. Yes, it is about crime, and - when the players decide to run amok in the city - said crime might end up taking the lives of innocents.

When it comes to its missions, even the GTA series generally does the right thing, which is to allow players to act in criminal ways but against equally evil folk. Still, sometimes the series goes places even the most hardcore of gamers could consider too far. Let's look at the darkest missions in Grand Theft Auto, which certainly stirred up controversy.

9 Friend Request (Grand Theft Auto 5)

If It's On TV, Then It's Probably Fake, Right?

5 Images
5 Images

Rockstar North
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by
  • Probably a bit too much
  • Though still pretty funny

GTA 5 has more of a comedic tone than GTA 4 did, but that often results in players laughing at pretty grim stuff. In this surprisingly interesting mission, Michael rigs a mobile device that ends up blowing up on the face of someone on live TV. The controversy of Friend Request comes from its real-life satire, as Michael needs to infiltrate Lifeinvader (Facebook) to give the CEO, Jay Norris (Mark Zuckerberg), a mobile phone that will explode and kill him when used. The idea of assassinating a real-life figure in a game is sure to stir up controversy.

8 Flatliner (Grand Theft Auto: Chinatown Wars)

Pretty Heartless

Your comment has not been saved

PHYSICAL

Powered by
  • A normal mission that culminates with a rather dark twist

In Flatliner from Grand Theft Auto: Chinatown Wars , players are tasked with rescuing and extracting an ill man. After driving and shooting through an army of armed targets, players would think that they'd finally saved this man's life, but that's not the case. In an incredibly grisly twist, the player learns that he'd merely taken this man to his execution spot. Even worse, he dies by literally having his heart pulled out right there and then. It's barbaric, cruel, but noted for the classic dark GTA humor.

7 Dead Meat (Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories)

Careful Where You Eat

Your comment has not been saved

  • Directly inspired by The Sopranos

One would think the GTA 3 spinoffs originally released for the Sony PSP would be tamer in an attempt to appease a wider audience, but that would be wrong. These games have some of the darkest content in the series. In this mission, for example, the main character not only kills a guy, but also butchers him, then processes his body to turn him into meat to be sold by his own family's restaurant without the knowledge of his family. This is probably modern GTA at its most visually gruesome, as it encourages cannibalism, even if unknowingly.

6 Helping Eddie Low (Grand Theft Auto 4)

Selling Your Soul To The Devil

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
Grand Theft Auto 4
Action
Adventure

9.1 /10

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by
  • This is not animal meat
  • Niko shouldn't be dealing with *this* type of criminal

Players spend the entirety of their GTA playthroughs working for people they know to be evil, but evil towards other people who are also in the crime game. That's not what's up with Eddie, a shady man Niko Bellik occasionally does business with. His missions are rather simple; this man just wants to get rid of some baggage. Sadly, this baggage is filled with human body parts, which seems to indicate that Eddie - a man with no other apparent connections to the crime world - is a serial killer, and Niko is his willing accomplice, furthering his immorality as players seem all-too-keen to help a serial killer get away with it.

5 Have A Heart (Grand Theft Auto 4)

Niko's Darkest Moment

  • This is more in line with what Trevor would do
  • And even he would probably not like it

At the start of GTA 4 , Niko Bellic doesn't hide the fact that he'd partaken in human trafficking before coming to Liberty City. In one mission, however, he seems to dig even deeper, as he begins to deal with an organ trafficker who buys frozen bodies off of Niko. It's a mission with an incredibly loathsome premise from the get-go, but it somehow gets even worse by the end of it, as, unlike with the Eddie Low missions in which Niko understands what he's doing is wrong, this time he seems to have no problem with it.

4 Bringing The House Down (Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories)

Nothing To Read Into This One...

  • All in the name of capitalism

In this mission in Liberty City Stories , the player is tasked with straight-up rigging and blowing up an entire city block. The plan is rather complex, so it could have very well included a step where the player sounded an alarm to get all the people out of their homes before blowing them up, but nope. This is just an absolutely foul thing to do, especially since we're not blowing up a block in crime city, but rather a whole block full of civilians just so a rich mogul can have his way. It's a supportive act of terrorism that makes Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 's No Russian look like child's play.

3 Hot Dog Homicide! (Grand Theft Auto 2)

Hot Coffee > Hot Dog

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by
  • By far, the most gruesome moment in the entire series

What's worse than killing a guy to sell his remains as meat? Doing that to a bunch of people. In this mission, the main character is tasked with loading up a bus with civilians, then taking them to a processing plant where they get butchered and turned into hot dog meat. The PlayStation version of the game doesn't feature civilian buses, so at least in that version, the player is only turning bad people into hot dogs, but even still, it's a gruesome fate. This mission would immediately go to the #1 on this list if not for the fact that this game was made in a different time, one where this kind of edgy content in a game wasn't as frowned upon as it is nowadays.

2 Hot Coffee (Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas)

A Mission So Controversial, It Was Actually Cut

5 Images
5 Images

Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by
  • The holy grail of GTA controversies

Though "Hot Coffee" is only part of a cut activity in GTA San Andreas , it just needs to be mentioned due to it being by far the most controversial moment in the history of the game. This is the first and only time the series could have shown players an actual graphic sex scene. There's, however, no violence in it, so Hot Coffee is actually pretty tame in comparison to many things the developers did before and after the release of San Andreas.

1 By The Book (Grand Theft Auto 5)

By What Book?

  • The Geneva Convention would not approve
  • Neither should players

By the time this mission comes, players are already aware that Trevor Phillips has no limits to what he'll do. Still, players wouldn't expect the game to have players have him straight-up torturing one man. They'd be wrong, as Trevor sure does engage in vile acts of torture, making use of a different set of items like jumper cables and even waterboarding. The poor guy who gets tortured doesn't even die by the end of it, but this is just too much for a game that came out in the 2010s. Trevor is one of the funniest characters in the entire series because of his lack of limits, but this is where things go too far, even for him.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds Cozy Sim with Japanese-Inspired Charm
item.description:
Xbox Game Pass continues to offer an interesting variety of games and genres to subscribers, this time with the addition of Minami Lane , a cozy life sim inspired by Japanese small-town charm. Every month, Microsofts gaming service adds and removes titles to keep the selection fresh for Xbox Game Pass members, with multiple subscription tiers to choose from.

There have already been a number of exciting games added to Xbox Game Pass in July so far, with a little something to appeal to most gamers. The month kicked off with Little Nightmares 2, the sequel to 2017s award-winning horror adventure game by Tarsier Studios. This was accompanied by Rise of the Tomb Raider and later joined by Legend of Mana, Trials of Mana , and most recently, Neon Giants cyberpunk RPG shooter The Ascent .

Beginning on July 9, Xbox Game Pass subscribers will gain access to Minami Lane , a bite-sized management sim that can be completed in just a few hours. Co-developed by Doot and Blibloop, the indie game was originally released in August 2024 on multiple platforms, and now Game Pass members can enjoy it at no additional cost.

Coming to Xbox Game Pass in July 2025

Minami Lane

July 9

Tony Hawks Pro Skater 3+4

July 11

Day-one release

High on Life

July 15

Abiotic Factor

July 22

Wheel World

July 23

Day one release

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

July 24

Day-one release

Grounded 2

July 29

Day-one early access release

The entirety of Minami Lane takes place on a cozy Japanese-inspired street with ramen shops, boba cafes, bookstores, flower boutiques, and of course villagers to interact with and befriend. After getting to know the diverse townsfolk, the player will be equipped with the knowledge needed to build the desired shops, stock them with attractive inventory, set prices, and draw in customers, thereby helping the small town to thrive.

But Xbox Game Pass subscribers still have more to look forward to in July. On the 11th, Tony Hawks Pro Skater 3+4, a remake of the original games released in 2001 and 2002, will be launching on the subscription service on day one. Squanch Games High on Life will be returning on July 15 after being removed from the service in mid-2024, and towards the end of the month, two day-one releases will be coming to Game Pass: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers and the early access version of Obsidian Entertainments Grounded 2 .
